meanings.definition: To make a low, guttural sound in the throat, as a dog.
meanings.sent1: The dog growled at the stranger approaching the house.
meanings.sent2: The bear growled warningly as hikers came too close.
meanings.sent3: The cat growled playfully at the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The thunder growled in the distance, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The engine growled loudly as the car accelerated down the highway.

meanings.definition: To utter in a low, harsh voice.
meanings.sent1: The old man growled his disapproval at the noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The teacher growled a reprimand at the unruly students.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy customer growled about the slow service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The wind growled through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The boss growled orders to his employees, expecting them to work faster.
